pr_title: Fixed 'Step to add single HTTP header to request #881'

timeline.bodyText: the step doesn't really check anything
timeline.author: valfirst
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -88,6 +88,37 @@ When I wait for presence of element by `$.data.testData` with `PT5S` polling int
 |When I issue a HTTP GET request for a resource with the URL '${requestUrl}'|
 ----
 
+=== Adding headers to HTTP request
+
+==== *_Info_*
+
+Checks that header `name` and `value` have been added to request

timeline.author: valfirst
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -88,6 +88,37 @@ When I wait for presence of element by `$.data.testData` with `PT5S` polling int
 |When I issue a HTTP GET request for a resource with the URL '${requestUrl}'|
 ----
 
+=== Adding headers to HTTP request
+
+==== *_Info_*
+
+Checks that header `name` and `value` have been added to request
+
+==== *_Wording_*
+
+[source,gherkin]
+----
+When I add request header with name `$name` and value `$value`
+----
+
+==== *_Parameters_*
+
+.  `name` - header name
+.  `value` - header value
+
+==== *_Usage_*
+
+.Sample.story
+[source,gherkin]
+----
+Scenario: Verify possobility to add request header with name and value

timeline.bodyText: it's better to use HTTP GET here

timeline.author: valfirst
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -116,6 +116,20 @@ public void setUpRequestHeaders(ExamplesTable headers)
         httpTestContext.putRequestHeaders(requestHeaders);
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Add request headers
+     * @param headers ExamplesTable representing list of headers with columns "name" and "value" specifying HTTP header
+     * names and values respectively
+     */
+    @When("I add request headers:$headers")
+    public void addRequestHeaders(ExamplesTable headers)
+    {
+        List<Header> requestHeaders = headers.getRowsAsParameters(true).stream()
+                .map(row -> new BasicHeader(row.valueAs(NAME, String.class), row.valueAs(VALUE, String.class)))
+                .collect(toList());

timeline.author: valfirst

timeline.bodyText: please format in a table-like view
timeline.author: valfirst
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -36,3 +36,17 @@ Scenario: Verify step "Then the connection is secured using $securityProtocol pr
 Given request body: ${request-body}
 When I send HTTP DELETE to the relative URL '/delete'
 Then the connection is secured using TLSv1.2 protocol
+
+Scenario: Verify step "I add request headers:$headers"
+Given request body: ${request-body}
+When I set request headers:
+|name        |value           |
+|Content-Type|application/json|
+Then `${responseCode}` is equal to `200`
+When I add request headers:
+|name          |value         |

maybe create function like
void performWithHeaders(ExamplesTable headers, Consumer<List<Header>> headersConsumer) 

to inline setUpRequestHeaders and addRequestHeaders methods bodies
